school_name: Francis W. Parker Charter Essential School
measure_success: Broadly, we hold ourselves accountable to students' potential; we ask, "Have we done everything we possibly can regarding student learning and well-being to create the conditions for students' success?" Our Criteria for Excellence are the skills in which all coursework is rooted. Across and within disciplines, every course is working to strengthen students' skills in these areas; we believe all students can reach mastery in these skills. We look often and closely at qualitative data; "looking at student work" protocols offer windows into student strengths, needs, as well as educator instructional adjustments.
promising_practices: Robust educator collaborative planning time. There was not a place for this in earlier questions. It is an absolute key feature since Parker opened, and has served us incredibly well through covid. Educator collaboration = a shared load. Students receive more engaging, inventive, and essential lessons when adults collaborate. We have an effective and clear system for how this works. It is well received by faculty, and is THE absolute key to providing strong work for students.
suggested_tags_s: Our school is operating on Remote Plus. Academic classes are largely remote, but social-emotional time is in-person once a week (in addition to remote Advisory every day). Students come to campus for outdoor Advisory activities; as well, many science labs are happening on campus, outside or in open-windowed class spaces. We made a fire-pit in the back grounds of the school campus; Advisors sign-up for it and invite their Advisees to a bonfire with all supplies and s'mores provided by the school. We also have outdoor movie evenings. We have invested in student well-being, while understanding we can offer a more collaborative learning environment remotely. We can live up to our Ten Common Principles better remotely, and contribute to student well-being both remotely and in-person.
public_contact_role: Director, Sizer Teachers' Center @ the Parker School
conditions_other_text: We were founded by Ted Sizer, Dean of the School of Education at Harvard, together with a handful of community members. The school has been research-based since its inception 26 years ago. Heterogeneous interdisciplinary learning in multi-age classrooms from 7-12 grade were foundational elements of the school from the beginning. Robust teacher collaboration time is another feature of the school's success with all learners.

school_name: Learn4Life Inglewood - Alta Vista Innovation High
measure_success: Since the majority of our students have been out of school 80+ days, we measure the success of our model by those students who either continue in our program and graduate or return to their traditional school to graduate. We have a 90% success rate, and 45% of those that graduate with us go on to post-secondary education.

measure_success: In our model learners from all backgrounds, abilities, language status, socio-economic status, etc. are educated together by teams of adults in fully inclusive general education classrooms. Our success is measured by each student having authentic agency within their classroom as they work toward acquiring mastery and skills that they can use to help them reach their goals and which they can use in their context of their daily lives. When our students have that authentic sense of belonging we witness their ability to make progress and demonstrate competency in a myriad of ways. We also are able to see them matriculate on to high school (and beyond) and attain success based on the growth they have experienced at CHIME.
suggested_tags_s: Constructivist approach to teaching and learning; co-teaching; positive behavior intervention and support; inclusion
